title: Microsoft Founded
description: Bill Gates and Paul Allen found Microsoft to develop BASIC for the Altair 8800.

title: Apple Founded
description: Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak form Apple Computer to sell the Apple I.

title: Oracle Founded
description: Larry Ellison and partners found SDL (later Oracle) to build a relational database.

title: Oracle v2 Release
description: The first commercially available SQL-based relational database management system.

title: Apple IPO
description: Apple goes public at $22 per share creating more millionaires than any IPO in history.

title: IBM PC Launch
description: IBM introduces the PC Model 5150 using Microsoft MS-DOS as the operating system.

title: Apple Lisa
description: The first personal computer with a graphical user interface aimed at business users.

title: Macintosh Launch
description: Apple launches the Macintosh with the iconic "1984" Super Bowl commercial.

title: Windows 1.0
description: Microsoft releases its first graphical operating environment for MS-DOS.

title: Oracle IPO
description: Oracle goes public on the NASDAQ raising $31.5 million.

title: Microsoft IPO
description: Microsoft goes public at $21 per share making Bill Gates a billionaire by age 31.

title: Microsoft Office
description: First version of the Office suite for Mac including Word Excel and PowerPoint.

title: Windows 3.0
description: The first version of Windows to achieve widespread commercial success.

title: IBM Crisis Year
description: IBM reports a record $8 billion loss leading to a massive strategic overhaul.

title: Windows 95
description: Major OS launch featuring the Start Menu and a massive global marketing campaign.

title: Microsoft Invests in Apple
description: Microsoft invests $150M in a struggling Apple to ensure the survival of its rival.

title: Steve Jobs 2nd Term
description: Jobs returns to lead Apple's transformation into a consumer electronics giant.

title: iMac G3 Launch
description: The colorful all-in-one computer that signaled Apple's return to profitability.

title: Google Founded
description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin incorporate Google in a garage in Menlo Park.

title: Steve Ballmer Era
description: Ballmer leads Microsoft through the PC era peak and the launch of Azure and Xbox.

title: Apple Store Opens
description: The first Apple retail stores open in Tysons Corner and Glendale.

title: iPod Launch
description: Apple introduces a pocket-sized digital music player with "1

title: Xbox Launch
description: Microsoft enters the gaming console market to compete with Sony and Nintendo.

title: IBM Buys PwC Consulting
description: IBM acquires PricewaterhouseCoopers' consulting arm to pivot toward services.

title: Gmail Launch
description: Google enters the email market with a 1GB storage limit in beta.

title: Google IPO
description: Google goes public using a Dutch Auction raising $1.67 billion.

title: Oracle Buys PeopleSoft
description: Oracle completes a $10.3 billion hostile takeover of its ERP rival.

title: IBM Sells PC Division
description: IBM sells its ThinkPad and PC business to Lenovo exiting the consumer market.

title: Google Buys Android
description: Google buys the mobile startup Android for an estimated $50 million.

title: Google Buys YouTube
description: Google acquires the video platform for $1.65 billion in stock.

title: iPhone Launch
description: The original iPhone launches and begins the modern smartphone era.

title: App Store Launch
description: Apple opens the App Store creating a new global economy for mobile software.

title: Oracle Buys Sun
description: Oracle acquires Sun Microsystems gaining Java and MySQL for $7.4 billion.

title: Microsoft Buys Skype
description: Microsoft acquires the VOIP leader for $8.5 billion to integrate with Office.

title: Tim Cook Era
description: Tim Cook succeeds Jobs and grows Apple into the world's most valuable company.

title: Satya Nadella Era
description: Nadella pivots Microsoft to "Cloud-first Mobile-first" revitalizing the company.

title: Alphabet Restructure
description: Google becomes a subsidiary of a new holding company called Alphabet Inc.

title: Microsoft Buys LinkedIn
description: Microsoft acquires the professional social network for $26.2 billion.

title: Apple $1 Trillion
description: Apple becomes the first public US company to reach a $1 trillion market cap.

title: IBM Buys Red Hat
description: IBM acquires the open-source leader for $34 billion to lead in Hybrid Cloud.

title: Oracle Buys Cerner
description: Oracle acquires the health records giant for $28.3 billion.

title: Microsoft Buys Activision
description: Microsoft completes $69 billion acquisition of gaming giant Activision Blizzard.

title: Microsoft Passes Apple
description: Microsoft overtakes Apple as the world's most valuable company due to AI growth.

title: Oracle Autonomous Data Center
description: Oracle launches its first fully AI-operated autonomous regional data hub.

title: Alphabet $3 Trillion
description: Alphabet (Google) surpasses the $3 trillion market cap milestone.

title: Bill Gates CEO Tenure
description: The era of Microsoft's explosive growth from a startup to a global software monopoly.

title: Larry Ellison CEO Era
description: One of the longest tenures in tech history building Oracle into a database powerhouse.

title: IBM PC Division Life
description: The lifespan of IBM's internal development and sale of personal computers.

title: Apple "Wilderness" Years
description: The period of decline and leadership instability at Apple between Jobs' two tenures.

title: Microsoft Office Lifecycle
description: The ongoing evolution of the world's dominant productivity suite across platforms.

title: The Browser Wars
description: The intense competition between Netscape and Microsoft's Internet Explorer.

title: Gerstner Turnaround
description: Louis Gerstner's transformation of IBM from a hardware firm to a services giant.

title: Steve Jobs 2nd Term
description: The "Golden Era" of Apple including the launch of iMac iPod and iPhone.

title: US v. Microsoft Antitrust
description: The landmark legal battle regarding Microsoft's bundling of IE with Windows.

title: The Lost Decade
description: A period where Microsoft's stock remained stagnant while pivoting to web services.

title: Mac OS X Classic Era
description: The lifespan of the "Cheetah" through "Catalina" operating system architecture.

title: Apple Retail Expansion
description: The growth of Apple Stores from the first two locations to a global presence.

title: Oracle's M&A Spree
description: A decade of aggressive acquisitions including PeopleSoft Siebel and Sun.

title: Google Cloud Evolution
description: The long-term development of Google's cloud infrastructure and workspace tools.

title: iPhone vs BlackBerry Era
description: The specific window of time where the iPhone disrupted and ended RIM's dominance.

title: The Big Data Wave
description: Google and IBM's heavy investment and dominance in large-scale data analytics.

title: Oracle v. Google Litigation
description: The 10-year legal battle over the use of Java APIs in the Android OS.

title: iPad Product Lifecycle
description: The era of the tablet computer as a distinct product category for Apple.

title: The Watson AI Era
description: IBM's long-term push to brand its AI and cognitive computing under Watson.

title: Tim Cook Era
description: The operational expansion era focusing on services and wearable tech.

title: Microsoft Surface Era
description: Microsoft's ongoing venture into first-party hardware for Windows.

title: Satya Nadella Era
description: The "Cloud First" era which saw Microsoft's valuation exceed $3 trillion.

title: Waymo Self-Driving Project
description: Alphabet's long-term bet on autonomous vehicle technology.

title: Google Silicon Era
description: Google's shift toward designing custom chips (TPUs and Tensor) for its devices.

title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
description: Oracle's pivot to Gen 2 Cloud to compete with AWS and Azure.

title: The Silicon Transition
description: Apple's 3-year phase-out of Intel chips in favor of Apple Silicon (M-series).

title: The Generative AI Race
description: The intense period of LLM development following the rise of ChatGPT.
